p: Our sensitivity analyses indicated that estimated mortality risks were robust when changing the df (5 to 8) for day of the year (Additional file 1: Figure S1) and df (4 to 6) for relative humidity (Additional file 1: Figure S2). Associations between heat waves and daily mortality almost kept unchanged with and without adjusting for air pollutants (TableÂ 3). Similar model fits were consistently observed by using Q-BIC as the evaluation standard, which also determined HW14 as the best predictive ability in assessing the mortality effects of heat wave (Additional file 1: Table S2).
